reviews_data.review_text: I come here every time I'm in town. Delicious pastry and sandwiches.
Today was my first time there and the staff, environment, and food was great. I look forward to coming again to such a cute caf√©!
Good place if you have a sweet tooth! Also the sandwiches are delicious.

We visited the NC location. D liked it so much we visited the SC location.  The food and coffee didn't disappoint.   The service was great, the food was delicious and the devour once again was amazing.  The old safe in front of the freezer was so cool.    Looks like Amelia's will be on our stop when we're coming back to the areas.

Updating from 2* to 1*. It's been 5 months and no one cared do respond. I love the original Amelie's in NoDA, Charlotte, the downtown one and the Pineville location but this Rock Hill one was a disappointment. The art and location are amazing, the building is the best out of all of them. Beautiful light, bright warm eclectic place, does not disappoint. But, the service was halfway decent. I was really surprised. The young kids were super nice but many of them were just standing around socializing. They got my tea order wrong, couldn't tell me what was inside the herbal tea, they just names the color. I asked if they have lavender, they didn't tell me it was about 75% chamomile and only part lavender. Loved the tea! But, I had to get up and tell them that they only gave me Earl grey leaves and there were no herbs in it, they forgot to put the second bag of tea in the cup after they charged me extra for it, which they have never done before. -1 ‚≠ê They walked straight past me, as if I was not standing by the pastries waiting to be served on the 2nd time. I don't know if they just ignored me on purpose because I was taking photos of the pastries or because they were having a staff meeting with 5 young people just sitting in a circle and not paying attention. Those bring our fresh pastries didn't say anything to the group, they just all were talking about what came out of the oven. I don't know happened, it took me actually coming up to the register and trying to get someone's attention to order a second pastry to go. - 1 ‚≠ê Our bigger table on the first floor was super sticky, must be because they use cleaning products on a table that should not be treated with chemicals or because they use dirty rags. That table should be taken care of, I couldn't place my hands on it or my bag. They took a while to make the food/tea. There was a ton of people working and the place was not packed after the lunch rush hour, we were there getting food after 1:30 on a Tuesday. Also, their music was too loud, it was hard to have a group conversation. And, I guess the large space does not have anything to absorb sound on the floor or walls so it was naturally louder then it could have been maybe because of the windows and all the hard surfaces. -1‚≠ê I was disappointed that the tarts had their fruits pushed to the side as if the entire tray was tilting sideways when they were made. It tasted great as usual because they use the same recipes as all the older locations but there was no finesse to it. A crooked pastry is not something ideal to serve a photographer who's trying to get a grea shot and all the fruits are pushed to the side overflowing on the tart itself. I was underwhelmed, it felt like an authentic, eclectic, local European bakery and deli was taken over by an American franchise with horrible training for their really young employees who didn't know how to offer good customer service skills and lacked people skills or the skills to take an order and deliver it correctly and timely, especially when they charged extra for it. To the owner. I hope you read and make some improvements because all the other locations had me come regularly and enjoy the place for hours. This was my first visit. The only reason I'll go back is because no one else makes those European pastries around here correctly, or unless I have to meet someone there. I was hoping it would be my new favorite spot down here since Rock Hill doesn't have many eclectic places to offer. Unfortunately unless they improve, I won't be coming back regularly to spend time in there.

Very cute French aesthetic, the bar underneath is incredibly cool and the food/drink here is great. Prices are a little high, so be prepared to pay a little more than you would at other cafes. But if you don't mind the extra prices for the quality, it's absolutely worth it. Their sweets are fantastic and they have a number of great sandwiches that I've enjoyed.

Amelie's Bakery in the beginning was a wonderful place to work. I was able to expand my knowledge and truly follow my aspirations to become a pastry chef. I was learning and growing, as I hoped. Then something shifted with in the managerial staff, that was unsettling. The happy, professional environment I once loved was slowly deteriorating. The new Assistant General Manager Renee, was unprofessional, hostile and combative in the work place. She often would speak poorly about other workers including myself. In addition, she would encourage a hostile catty work environment. I recently had the flu and decided it would be best to take the time off of work. After going to the doctor, I felt it would be best not to expose my coworkers. I even spoke to Amanda who advised I would be covered and report to work Monday 11/28/22. I was following the handbook and proper protocol as instructed and stayed in communication throughout the week. As I returned to work Monday 11/28, I was able to clock in, then immediately directed by Renee to come have a private conversation. She then advises I had been terminated effective immediately. I was shocked at her demeanor as she was delivering this termination with sheer gratification. She even smirked as she delivered this news. I couldn't believe her lack of compassion or empathy as she was letting me go. I  tried to provide the doctors note to prove I wasn't in violation. But all she insisted was a point system which was never disclosed during any point of the duration of employment. I am at a loss of words, how a place which once provided me satisfaction and joy became such a dramatic, catty, unprofessional work environment. Poor management is the cause of my termination and it is truly disheartening that a company would keep such a deplorable person on their staff. I wouldn't suggest working here, as you will more than likely have the same situation occur right before the 90 day mark.
Good sandwiches! Mocha is really delicious!
Great pastries and sandwiches. Friendly staff in a cool atmosphere!

Very unique atmosphere, with a random assortment of the chairs, tables, and wall decor. I ordered the chicken Florentine quiche and I was very impressed by how it turned out. Service with quick and staff were friendly. A bit on the pricier side but I would say it's worth it.

Super tasty food. Big space, but the design and general aesthetic of this place could you use some attention. The mismatched chairs, weird art felt, and odd fixtures were not cohesive. Feels like it has a lot of potential though‚Ä¶ and, if you don't care that much about aesthetic, it's a 5 star place.

This place is AMAZING! Everything is absolutely delicious and affordable! We only spent about $15 per person! I've been here for lunch and desserts twice now, and both times it was phenomenal! I love their sandwiches, soups, and salads! The √©clairs are so good! The vanilla cream inside was very creamy and had great flavor. Their tartlets are delicious and come in many varieties, including my favorite: lemon raspberry. Their cr√®me br√ªl√©e is the best I've ever had, and the coffee is very good as well. I love the atmosphere here! Lots of beautiful paintings adorn the walls, and many decorations include repurposed materials. I HIGHLY recommend eating here if you are coming to Rock Hill. I will certainly be back soon!
Always an awesome experience Their quiches taste homemade
Best almond croissant I've ever had. The cappuccino is amazing. Lovely coffee shop- just what I needed to get some work done!
Eclectic, great selection, cute venue, lots of space. Yummy treats and coffee.
Great atmosphere, & the cinnamon french toast was delicious. Would *definitely* visit again! üëç
This is my favorite Amelies location. The atmosphere is intimate and charming. The French press coffee and food is delicious.
Macaroons and eclairs are delicious. Friendly staff. Casual environment.

Very good French style bakery and eatery. Pastries were good to excellent. Service is casual / friendly. I will definitely go back and suggest everyone try Amelie's at least once.  Interior is charming and somewhat bohemian, and very comfortable. Look for a used book rack on the second floor. BTW second floor seating offers a good view of the streets of Rock Hill, a great place for people watching. Outside seating is available. Street parking is available, but certainly not guaranteed.
Macarons are breakfast foods, right? Breakfast and treats were delicious, and the charm of the former bank makes it even better!
Recommended üëç.

It isn't fair how good their food is.  Edit: 4 years later this food is still amazing. This picture doesn't do them justice but trust me when I tell you that even the stuff that doesn't look particularly fancy or special will still knock your socks off. I ate my mini tart before having a chance to get a picture. The sandwich has plenty of delicious topping, they don't skimp on the meats like some places, and their provident mayo (spelling?) adds a touch of beauty to even a regular ol' sandwich.  Come here and you will eat, drink, and be merry.

This place is consistently great, work friendly workers who will get to know you, and a great atmosphere. Gets busy for pockets throughout the day but only for a few minutes at a time. Great coffee, french desserts, and breakfast sandwiches.
Delicious desserts and amazing service by the staff! Love coming to this location!

Decent selection of pastries to choose from. Had the apple tart and the coconut macaroon. The macaroon was slightly dry and overcooked, the tart was rich and delicious. Would come back if we were in the area.
Wonderful place, just what we were looking for.  Good coffee, French pastries and great staff. Come, see for yourself.

I was really looking forward to the pastries but they didn't have any plant-based or vegan pastries. They do have other vegan options including coffee drinks, sandwiches, and soups. Service was friendly and decor was eclectic.

I came with my family and bought desserts/pastries  for a party of 5. When we came out, since they told us we could not eat inside because they were about to close, but we realized we did not had any napkins. I went back and kindly knocked on the door since it was locked. My daughter which was beside me, was there watching how the 3 young ladies that were working the shift were ignoring me/us.  I stayed there and made signs for napkins, and  after a while a blonde young lady with a very bad attitude, according to her body language and the way she came to us. She brought us 5 napkins and she stated to me that if I needed more napkins I could  go around the corner to a Jimmy Johns.  I told her, that  I just came out of the Amelie's location, and spent money with them, that I am their customer and they could have been kind to me and provide good service. She tried to close the door in my face while I was talking, all this in front of my  little daughter. I said to her that this was not the way to treat clients. At the time there was a young lady with black hair working on the cashier machine, and another one just looking. I have never had an experience like this, I will  never come to this location again. Hopefully this lady wasn't being racist to us.  Staff should have a customer experience training. Experience is all in all types of industries.

I've been in the area for several years and never taken the opportunity to visit the Bakery, I was severely disappointed with myself for never coming sooner. For my first visit, I ordered a BLT baguette (from the build your own sandwich menu), a chocolate croissant, and a nice cup of tea. The BLT was fantastic, the bacon was delicious. The croissant was very good, nice and flakey and tasted very fresh.
A bit pricey but the baked goodies are so good I keep coming back. Nice service and interior french vibe is so cute.
My new favorite place
A very nice place. They have a nice little environment about them, and me and my mom used to go here and get macaroons. Also they support lgbtq so thats cool

Very nice people and very nice place and very yummy and sweet goodness all around there. My oldest bought a ton of stuff and they was very patient and careful not to make sure nothing tipped over and all of them we saw there was very big sweethearts there great place all should check it out.
First timer! Coffee was outstanding along with croissants!! Staff is knowledgeable and outgoing. Will be back!

Mothers Day Treat.. I searched for a French bakery nearby and found Amelie's‚Ä¶ i wanted to get some treats for Mothers Day breakfast.  We picked up a tomato, spinach, mozzarella quiche and spicy sausage, cheese, jalape√±o quiche.. Can I just say yummy.. both were good, but really loved the spicy sausage one.  We also got the almond croissant and plain croissant.. The almond croissant was crazy good.. Can't wait to go back to Amelie's to try some other things‚Ä¶
We always enjoy coming here. Best macaroons around!

OMG! This is THEY BEST COFFEE SHOP IVE RVER BEEN TOO!!! Such a wonderful atmosphere and soooo many delight's! I Love the love fence upfront ( take a picture!) And the food is AMAZING!  I had a Lorain quiche, and a pull apart bread with a double shot of Expresso.  It used to be a old bank, the even have a second floor! I also love the atmosphere!
Excellent atmosphere. Great selection of drinks and food. Covered Outdoor sitting available.
Nice atmosphere, employees were amazing and kind, and the sandwiches and pastries were awesome. You should definitely check it out.
Rude service,  food unremarkable,  tea was awful. Won't be back.

Had to get a "do over"  on a sandwich but complaint was met with appreciation and concern. Very positive by Ms Heather. $$$ prices but worth it. No military discount. Clean dining area with a few outside spots.
The food was delicious, they have the best macorons.

French macarons:  this is the place to get the best selection of macarons.  The salted caramel is my favorite, top left.  That with a cup of loose leaf earl gray tea to enjoy at the restaurant before I took the rest home to enjoy.  Their boxes make a great presentation to even gift someone.

Girl taking my order was more concerned about how my mask was on my face than wanting to take my order. It was on my nose but not to her satisfaction! Smh..this mandate has alot of ppl really feeling themselves and im so over it! Wont be back until this is over!
The pastries here are always good. I liked they had options to eat meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The staff was friendly and helpful.

I've been wanting to visit for YEARS and finally today was the day! No disappointments whatsoever. The staff were extremely helpful, efficient, knowledgeable, and friendly. My son and I chose a white chocolate and a raspberry small mousse and a variety of macrons. The mousse was heavenly, not too sweet and melts in your mouth. The macrons are wonderful and are a perfect sweet treat. My son really enjoyed the cotton candy macron. They have a wide variety of macrons to chose from for all cravings. The coffee and hot chocolate were delicious as well. Amelie's is a gem right in the middle of downtown, you should definitely visit!
We just left there. Christopher, was very helpful!
Smooth relaxing experience

READ- The service was okay, it took forever to get food and none of the tables were really clean. Expensive too. Food was just okay. Hopefully its just a staffing issue. 5 stars for the friendly atmosphere. It's a rough time for all businesses.
Everything tasted great.. and we got a lot to try out.

Overall, this Amelie's falls short on their savory items. The pastries have always been decent, but the past 2 times I got the spinach, asparagus, and leek soup it has been awful. Today the broth was oily instead of creamy and completely separated. I only had spinach in my soup as well. Not sure where the other veggies were, but I'm very disappointed for $7 a bowl. Lastly, my to-go bowl of soup was only filled up 3/4 of the way. Not like it matters since it was like drinking oil. When I've had this soup in the past from other locations, the broth is super creamy and flavorful, and it's loaded with veggies. This version of the soup was oily and beyond bland. Would not recommend this location.
Great ambience, cute French decor and yummiest macaroons. Extensive coffee menu (loved salted caramel brownie mocha). Will definitely visit again

Macaroons were a little hard.  Place is nice,  people are nice.  The lemon Macaroons were very hard,  the s'more were better,  the apple tart was good. Had to take away a star for the dirty tables.  I believe all the tables had crumbs on them.
Fantastic food and fast friendly service. One of the best sandwiches I've had in many years. Am√©lie's is a wonderful addition to Downtown Rock Hill.
A delightful stop for treats

Service was really well. I asked for a ice coffee with extra creamer and with caramel, I tasted it and it was straight bitterness. I also got some pastries and my marcaron had a hair on it, my friend got big pieces of chicken that wasn't shredded its very hard to eat. Overall I give 3/5,

This is the third Amelia's location I have visited and all have the same high quality offerings though this one seemed to have less to choose than the two Charlotte locations. Staff was friendly, patient and helpful in explaining the various desserts. Would recommend you visit if you are in the mood for something sweet!
delicious, cake and Coffee.
Order a birthday cake for my grandson and we were all very disappointed.  $50 for an 8‚Äù cake you would think it would be moist and taste great. It was dry and awful. Will never buy from them again.
Yes please!!! Never a disappointment! Munchies, coffee and something sweet üòùüòù

I was there not 5 minutes ago and I had my dog with me. He was in my hands and picked up. There was a girl who greeted me (white female) multicolored hair and told me dogs aren't allowed inside. That I could completely understand. I asked her if I could just place my order since I came in already knowing what I wanted and she still denied it. That's not the fact or why I left 5 stars. I left it because there was a (black gentlemen)red hat and black shirt,  that followed me out not knowing was he a worker there or not but he assisted me and said I can still order just sit outside and ect. I kindly told him it was okay and still left but it's the genuine fact he came out to still help or serve me. I know there are rules for stores and stuff but I really appreciated him. I was having a terrible day and all I wanted was one macaroon (they are already made so wouldn't take more than 3 minutes to box and send me on my way) I just Wanted to leave this here thank you again gentlemen.
The tarts was alright but the drinks were ugghhh. Starbucks has way better drinks. And there bread was way to hard. Don't mean to offend anyone just being honest.
Great gluten free options!!

I have enjoyed every Amelie's I've gone to and this one is no exception. It's on a great corner spot in downtown Rock Hill so I imagine they stay fairly busy. I went on a weekday morning and it was calmer. I enjoyed a hibiscus soda and their tartines and a fruit tart. It was exactly what I needed. I could sit inside an Amelie's all day either people watching or working or reading.
Best treats and sweets in Rock Hill.

Love the interior. Beautiful old architecture meets industrial french countryside. Wonderfully eclectic. The chai tea is perfectly spiced, the hot chocolate is dark and rich, and the croissants are buttery and flaky. The croque monsieur is made with a mild dijon and rich bechamel which I highly reccomend. The lemon tart is TART. The crust is crumbly and just sweet enough. The lemon custard is lip puckering and a perfect contrast to the meringue. The macarons aren't too sweet which I love. 10/10 would visit again.

I love this place! The macarons are so light, and the flavors are always great. I also love the tarts! I make the five hour drive to visit my friend just so I can come to Amelie's and take a plate of pastries home with me. I also learned how to say "Cafe Marcotter" which is pretty neat. Great bakery!
Super great!!! Love how kind everyone is at this location :)
Best pastries around. Great spot for a casual brunch / lunch.
Cute little bakery and Cafe The sweets were amazing!!

I really enjoy the atmosphere, the drinks, and the food! But after working from home for a year, I like to go out and get some studying done that isn't at the desk I basically live at. The WiFi is spotty, and I noticed multiple customers resorting to using their mobile hotspots. It is a major frustration to get there, and realize it's not working that day. I think the DHCP lease configurations on the router are to blame. If this were fixed I would certainly come back often!!

A little divine secret in Rock Hill. Delicious sandwhiches and salads. Honestly, who can pass by and not be tempted by the little jewel tarts, ravishingly beautiful cakes and other decadent desserts displayed in the glass case? I say if you havent stepped into this lovely french cafe', come give it a try!
I was honestly a bit disappointed to not be served a salad with my sandwich. It felt a bit incomplete of a plate (and overpriced too). But the food was good.
Coolest, tastiest, most eclectic breakfast place I have been to. Place has a french theme, good food, and lots of windows to brighten up your day!
Food is usually pretty good, but is not quite authentic French. Their fruit pastries are really good and macaroons are also pretty good.

My wife and I went down town Rock Hill to walk around. We saw Amelie's, decided to go in. Wow oh wow!!!! Awesome sweet treats so beautiful to look at. Can't believe how beautiful sweet's could be. Is is awesome. I go every weekend now for 4 weeks. It's a little high on the price. BUT I don't think you can get this type of sweet's anywhere else. They also have different types of coffee and food. Please give them a try
Yummy foods
Always a joy to go and the desserts are wonderful. Lunch is good with a nice selection. I prefer the outdoor set up at Park Road over that of Rock Hill, but they both have delicious food!
Great chicken salad sandwiches and even better people!
Love their sandwiches and pastries!

If you haven't been to Amelie's yet, then you need to get it in gear and go. I ate at two of their locations and both were WONDERFUL!!! I'm a French Cuisine freak, so I am highly critical of French Restaurants, Bakeries, Cafes and Bistros. You can't go wrong with Amelia's. The food is GENUINELY French and oh, so, so, good. The girls at The Rock Hill location could have been more friendly and hospitable, but perhaps they were just having one of those not so good mornings, we all have. BUT. It sure didn't come out in the food. Everything was made to perfection. If I had more time in the area, I would have been back for more. This is definitely a must go to French Bakery and Restaurant. The Croque Monsieur was great. As all of the other items I had. And you can't walk out without any kind of the bakery items or you will be missing even more good items. The pastries and the small mousse cups never made it to lunch hour. I will most definitely be back for more of Amelie's. The best way to sum it up, is I told them they needed to open one up in Chattanooga, TN, where I'm from. They really deserve more than 5 stars.

Wonderful selection of gluten free products with knowledgeable staff. Even new staff members knew immediately where to find gluten free listing of products when she was unsure. Always change gloves and box separately. It's as close as you can get to gluten free considering it's a shared kitchen and I feel they take great care to offer the best experience possible.
I love this place. Excellent coffee and bakery!

This place is so much fun! Awesome coffee, the baguette was the best I've ever had. My daughter got macarons & I got an eclair for my husband. Sat outside & pretended we were in France! I just wish they had vegan treats!!
(Translated by Google) Excellent crousants and very good service !!  (Original) Excelentes los crousants y muy buen servicio!!
Best macarons! The entire menu is delicious!
Great customer service and tasty treats!
Delicious treats!

The food and coffee here were wonderful! I loved my lavender flavor added to dark roast brew...so good! The bakery items were very tasty and the staff very friendly. Indoors was decorated with a unique style and they even had a miniature Pont des Arts outside on the railing! I will definitely be back...my mom and I enjoyed our stop for a midweek birthday brunch!
Very disappointed at the Rock Hill location.  Macarons were definitely not fresh. Crust was just hard. I'll stick with NoDa.
Really enjoyed the coffee and sweet treats. Visited after a volleyball tournament at the Rock Hill Center.
Never disappointed! Best macarons around! Great service and fair pricing considering the quality product you receive.
I Eat a Macarons and Tarts. It's that is good
Delicious pastries, coffee and breakfast sandwiches. We went out of our way to stop.
Yummy

Absolutely delicious! They have a lot of choices to choose from! The only thing I could say to make it the best place in the area, would be to add vegan desserts to the mix. Such as no egg or dairy at all . If you're wondering whether you should go I definitely recommend it!
I always enjoy this place.
Amazing as always, best pastries in Rockhill by far.
Love it! I had mouse topped with a chocolate covered strawberry. It was awesome.
The latte Chain tea recommendedüòâüòäüíõüíô‚ù§

Cute little bakery in downtown Rock Hill. It offers sandwiches and such, but we went for dessert! The macarons are crunchy and full of flavor and I'm told the fruit tarts are delicious too (even though they were scarfed down without even offering me a bite!). It looks like downtown is undergoing revitalization, so Amelie's is well positioned.
Just amazing

This place is UNREAL! So so good! All of their pastries have been out of this world, so we just pick something random when we go and always enjoy it. Their soups are delicious as well as their breakfast sandwiches on croissants.  We've been going for years and the only things we haven't "loved" is the turkey on the turkey sandwiches.
Always good service and good food!
Delightful bakery and cafe with AMAZING macarons! The PB&J was our favorite, with Lemon Lavender as a close second.
Amelies is great, the food is amazing and it's a great place to go to get work done.

Were in Rock Hill for the weekend and headed here to get some good espresso drinks. This is more so a cheeky play on a French patisserie than a bakery, many more petit gateaux than breads. The menu is quite expansive which was a little overwhelming, but the staff was friendly in assisting. COVID has definitely changed the in store experience, would like to come back during non-COVID times.

We stopped by after reading positive reviews online. Our sandwiches were very good. I was disappointed in the desserts. The macarons were over $2 each but didn't really have much flavor other than sweetness.
We tried numerous items, everything was amazing!
Nice place

Obviously this is uncontrollable, but seating inside is not available. This is a big reason why people visit the franchise. Friendly and helpful staff and great food. Steep prices but its expected for a specialty cafe.

I have been here many times and the desserts never disappoint. But i am always disappointed with there food. I got a chicken sun-dried tomato with pesto sandwich and the chicken was very plan tasting, dry, fatty, and to chunky; i would of liked shredded chicken . I thought it was have fresh sun-dried tomatoes on the sandwich it just had a paste like that semi tasted like sun-dried tomatoes.  But the desserts and service is always amazing and will continue to go back for that but not the food.

Fantastic Service today ! This location is singularly unique as its in an old bank. The old bank vault is now filled with French Pastries. 6 staff behind the counter all came together to wait on just 3 of us. Plenty of seating outside. Freshly made french bakery goodness. We loved it.
Great food and pastries. A little pricey but with it.

I've been a frequent customer to Amelie's Rock Hill for about 3 years so I can honestly write a review. Also I've worked in food service management for 6 years. You will not find a more consistent and welcoming coffee shop in the area. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Coffee is always hot and fresh, no complaints at all. To all the naysaying self-proclaimed ‚ÄúGoogle Review Tour Guides‚Äù. Shut up and go home. No one values your overly critical, negative and privileged input. You cannot write a review after 1 visit.
I really love the fact we have an Amelie's in Rockhill SC! Its even better than the one in Charlotte NC! Love the salted caramel brownies ‚ù§üß°üíõüíöüíôüíúü§éüñ§ü§ç they are to die for!!!
I love  this place.  Their breakfast has been great as were there delicious desserts!   Really delicious!!
Awsome spot except they closed their bathroom for Covid.  My bladder doesn't know about Covid not to mention the #1 rule of Covid...wash your hands (just not here.)
Not my cup of tea.
Their macaroons are always delicious!

Absolutely gorgeous, delicious desserts! The ham & guyere quiche was just perfectly crisp and light - heavenly.  We travel from Columbia to Rock Hill just for a visit to Amelie's and it has never once failed to amaze us!
I took my nieces to let them get some treats, they loved it!
Tasty
This place is always amazing!
Delicious treats!! Beautiful decor and ambience! Looking forward to the day when I can visit and stay inside after quarantine is over!!

The coffee was good and the service was good. Employees were very nice.  However I am giving it 2 stars because they required masks to be worn to order.  Disappointing to have to be treated like this to simply order some coffee.
I can't wait to come back when everything is open and sit down to enjoy some macaroons and a cappuccino üò©üíïüíï The coffee is so good and the atmosphere is the CUTEST!
Great curbside pickup service, fast and fresh food. The twice baked almond croissant was gigantic! Yummy cappuccino and quiche.
You must a mask when you enter.  The quiche is still perfect!

My first time at Amelie's. I purchased macarons. I also purchased an entremet and a petit chocolate gateau. The macaroons are wonderful. I have not had anything like it. I highly recommend Amelie's. The staff is friendly and helpful.
My favorite coffee shop and favorite Amelie's location!! Great customer service! Super friendlyüòä

Extremely frustrated this morning, when finally on the website it shows you have something in stock that you haven't had for a while, then we get there and you don't have it anymore. The fact you already paid for it you should've put it aside, happy Mother's Day. It takes two seconds to update, stop being lazy

Social distancing is difficult for everyone. But there is no need for the young ladies behind the counter at Amelie's to be as openly hostile and bitter as they are. Amelies is too expensive to have rude staff.
Love the decor and the food! Nice place. Snuggled in downtown Rock Hill SC.
Good food
Great as always
Cool place
Amazing macaron and creme brulee
The service is nice and very accomodating.
Super nice place!

Very good food. Large dessert menu and delicious lunch menu. Fast service. Eclectic atmosphere. Friendly staff. The Roast beef sandwich is said to be the best you will ever eat. I had the Cherry, Pecan Goat Cheese Salad with Salmon, so so yummy. Desert I had a Berry Torte and a Dark Chocolate Raspberry Torte. Prices were very reasonable for the quality of the food. I would and will definitely be back.
Fun little bakery and restaurant.  The desserts are amazing, great tasting coffee and the sandwiches are so good.
Awesome food an atmosphere
Excellent pistachio macarons and pastries. The latte I was served was also very decent.
The coffee is always good but the place looks dirty every time I go
Try everything. It's all great food
Good deserts

I've been here for dessert, a snack, a drink, and the ambiance alone. I love Amelie's as an establishment and constantly cycle between all the Amelie's locations. Good desserts, drinks, tea, and food items.  With formalities aside, I've been pondering if I may have the honor to take your hand in marriage, mademoiselle... May I..?

Amelie's is my all time favorite coffee shop but I have a complaint about this location in particular.   There are barely any outlets which makes it hard to find a good space to work If you have a computer that needs to be plugged in. This of course is a business issue and not a customer issue however, today (after working in the coffee shop all day with no complaints) an older white woman complained to the workers that she almost tripped over my chord. Which led them to come over and ask me to unplug my set up and possibly move. My chord was not in a main walkway and there of course were many other routes to her seat however, I chose to be compliant and unplug.  My grievance with this is that this is a coffee shop and many others come here to work. Without proper outlets I cannot work. The lack of outlet and placement of outlets are NOT my problem. However, due to the complaint of one white woman I was expected to unplug and possibly relocate.  Make out of this what you will but It was not a great experience for me.
Needed a little pick me up and a sweet snack and Am√©lie's definitely hit the spot! Wonderful macarons and excellent coffee.

What a pleasant surprise to find this coffee shop. I had a great cup of coffee and a tasty pastry. Even drag the wife there later the same day. We will be back next time. We are cruising through town.

This place is a hidden gem ! I had the cookie dough macaroon and the pecan tart. Both were very satisfying, my preference was the pecan tart. The pecan tart was not overbearingly sweet. Also the location has great energy, culture, and is well decorated. The prices are affordable as well, i highly recommend this place for a bakery that has great products specifically French desserts
The sweets at phenomenal and the atmosphere makes it even better!
Our favorite dessert/breakfast place

Wonderful coffees, teas, soups, sandwiches, salads, and desserts. I had the cherry, pecan, and goat cheese with mixed greens salad but replaced the regular dressing for the pomegranate raspberry vinegrette salad dressing along with peppermint tea. It was delicious. The ambiance was very inviting, the kind where you want to sit with a friend all afternoon and chat. And of course their dessert case called to me to try out one of their delicious looking cakes, pies, pastries, or cookies.

Can't say enough about this delightful caf√©! The food and beverages are always so very delicious (Th√© Chai Cr√®me and the Fig, Bacon + Brie Tartine are sublime), customer service is excellent, the location is beautiful (so much natural light!) and so perfect whether you're staying for 10 minutes or 2 hours. The atmosphere and decor are fun and relaxing, and the vibe is just so positive.
Fun place to go, fresh coffee
Quick and friendly service in a cozy and welcoming atmosphere.
The tea is unique.. try the Russian Tea.. the sandwiches and desserts never fail.. if you want a decent priced cup of tea and coffee highly recommend.. 5 stars from me

I know asking for cold tea is silly and it takes a while. Thank you for taking the time to make my visit extra special by providing a wo derful place to wait for my tea to steep. Thanks for having wonderful sweets and wonderful employees.
Fix your links can't find ya on directions
Went there for a baby shower- so very nice
Delicious

Loved the pastries, the are not cheap though.

Love all of Amelie's locations. Food and drinks on point as always. The only drawback to this location is it gets very noisy because of the building. Not an issue unless your visiting with someone hard of hearing as I was. Otherwise Amelie's is always a fantastic treat!
Great food and desserts and atmosphere
My very favorite French cafe when I come to the Charlotte area.
South Carolina
Has a realistic French vibe. Second floor provides quite space for conversation or reading... of course, their pastries amazing!
Good but expensive
Wonderful little French bakery set up in an old bank. They even use the safe as a huge walk in refrigerator. You have to try the tortes and Carmel topped brownie if you stop in.
Great food and staff.

Went there for breakfast & loved it! The croissants sandwiches were awesome, they had plenty of bacon & the croissants were fresh. The  creme br√ªl√©e French soda was creamy, but light, & not overly sweet. All the pastries were so beautiful, the macarons were delicious, especially loved the seasonal cranberry one. My only suggestion would be to have a register at the dessert case. The line is in efficient, you queue in one line to get dessert & another to pay for them. All in all it was great, & we'll definitely be back!
Yummy macaroons
They have the best chocolate croissants, I always go here when I have money to splurge. It's always amazing!! Plus they have the sweetest workers!!
It's a cute little place that has a huge hipster vibe. I had a tart and a chai latte (the bomb!), which I enjoyed. They're kind of expensive but nothing too crazy, and I really loved the atmosphere.
Great desserts with a great atmosphere in Old Town Rock Hill
OMG!! if your a starbucks fan this place will be your new favorite. The staff were very kind and the drink i had was perfect to say the least. Merci Beaucoup!
Great selection and reasonable prices.
Love the speciality expresso drinks and the tarts
This place is amazing! Great CS, coffee and pastries! Recommended!
Quick service and delicious treats. I highly recommend the hot chocolate, salted caramel brownie, and chocolate cinnamon macarons.
This is such a cute bakery! Loved the pasteries

Good coffee. Great desserts.
Nice quiet place for good food.
Friendly staff , great service and great coffee
Delicious coffees and decadent pastries, this is one of my favorite spots! Love the decor as well.

NOT AUTISM FRIENDLY. We were asked to leave after paying $45 (including a $7 tip) because we brought in  a happy meal (one of the few things our austistic daughter will eat). I was holding the box and drink while I ordered. It wasn't like we smuggled it in. We sat down to eat upstairs, when the manager-who took the order-delivered our sandwiches and THEN told us we would have to eat outside or leave due to thier policy. We tried to explain but she would have none of it. It was in the 40's and windy that day. We went and ate in the car. My daughter asked to go back and tell the manager how she felt. (I don't think she cares about people like me, she saod). She did so only to be told that the policy is because people would cone in, not buy anything, and leave a mess. Funny thing, they have a display about how they are sponsoring  an "inclusive park". I guess the resturant is a different story. How rude.
Everything was great. Service was wonderful and the pastries were amazing! Next time I plan to try the sandwiches.
Love this bakery

The atmosphere is cute and quaint. You may have to share a table with others you don't know. The desserts are not as good as other places. The salads are great with homemade dressings and fresh, quality ingredients. They often inspire me to recreate them at home. The sandwiches are good especially when you choose something that pairs well with the croissant. The soups I've tried haven't been anything that I'd come back again for but I'm hoping that changes eventually. However, my family has grown up with my homemade soups like oven roasted butternut squash soup with homemade chicken stock and a good splash of cream served with garlic buttered croutons, fresh parmesan, and toasted & lightly salted pecans on top. The fruit cups are delicious, fresh, and a great option to add to your main entree at lunch or dinner.
Food was good, staff was great, food is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.
great selection of espresso and baked goodies!
Food and coffee good one individual was not having a good day and was not the most helpful and that dropped the rating. Good help is paramount

(Translated by Google) We are 2 French people and we wanted to try Am√©lie's French Bakery. We were disappointed with the food which is very far from what you can find in France. (Example: The "croques-monsieurs" in the form of a croissant, the chicken sandwich served in a butter croissant... Very surprising!!!). The food was totally Americanized. And not even a good wand in sight. What a pity... Sincerely.  (Original) Nous sommes 2 Fran√ßais et nous avons voulu tester la boulangerie Am√©lie's French Bakery. Nous avons √©t√© d√©√ßu de la nourriture qui est tr√®s loin de ce que l'on peut trouver en France. (Exemple : Les ¬´ croques-monsieurs ¬ª sous forme de croissant, le sandwich au poulet servit dans un croissant au beurre... Tr√®s √©tonnant!!!). La nourriture a √©t√© totalement am√©ricanis√©. Et m√™me pas une bonne baguette √† l'horizon. Quel dommage... Sinc√®rement.

Wild mushroom duxelles with Gruyere cheese is an awesome vegetarian sandwich! My wife's soup and salad were equally outstanding. The bakery and pastry displays are making me drool, even though I'm too full for dessert...

Decadent desserts and delicious coffee are what this great place does best, and its Rock Hill location is the local chain's coolest location. The balcony upstairs offers a really nice view of the entire establishment, and there is outdoor seating available as well. If you're in the Rock Hill area and looking for a unique spot for coffee, a sandwich or a homemade dessert item that you won't forget, come here!!
Makes really great treats and drinks! I love going there whenever I can!
Delish.

Meandered to downtown Rock Hill for a treat for the kids (and myself!). I particularly wanted to try their seasonal items.  Upon entering you are met with a sweet smell that can only put a nostalgic smile on your face.  The lady behind the counter was extremely patient as well as helpful and knowledgeable as we decided on our fare.  I liked the bright, large case so that we could see what we wanted to get.  The seasonal items also marked wig Blue description rather than white which helped me find them easily.  We decided on the chocolate raspberry torte, mini pumpkin pie tart, sweet potato layered bar (as delicious as beautiful!), and the s'mores eclair.  All were delicious and we were able to enjoy outside and watch the antics of downtown Rock Hill and view the changing trees.  Cannot wait to return: with kids, myself, on a date, etc  Bob appetite y'all!

This place makes some of the finest pastries that I know of in Rock Hill and many other cities. You may find the prices to be high but qualities never cheap. They seem to have some nice sandwiches from the pictures I've seen I'll have to try them out next time. I've shopped here often and I've never been disappointed.
Had some delicious beef stroganof soup this time!
Delicious treats, attentive staff
Epic
The sandwich was very good, very simple. The pastry was not quite as good as Panera Bread. I would definitely return

They have a great selection of pastries. The atmosphere is great, friendly staff most of the time. The food, however, was lacking. To the untrained palate, I suppose it would be satisfying but Ibpersonally found the fair very lacking.
Excellent lunch and gluten free desserts!

Every single time I have gone to this place, it has been absolutely amazing. The Rock Hill branch is my favorite hands-down. You can sit near the window and just enjoy the peace of downtown Rock Hill. I recommend trying the chocolate mousse cup and the Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e-they torch it right in front of you!!
Wish it was more genuinely French. I m sort of dissapointed
Great place and amazing coffee and desserts

I've been to France a bunch of times and this place is by far as close, if not better to some bakeries in France. The atmosphere is supper cool! Lots to look at it and enjoy while there. The upstairs sitting is cozy and perfect. The croissants and macaroons are to die for! So many pastries to choose from. My wife ordered the quiche Loraine and WOW! The best I've tasted - ever! This place is worth a visit.

You can go to other bakeries and coffee shops and get treats that are about a good as your mom's specialty and that's fine, but this is the first real bakery I've ever been too, blows everywhere else out of the water. Coffee is great too. Have been to several locations, and all of them are great
Love the bakery and staff. Always informative and helpful with a smile.

Food was actually quite tasty, but service was poor. Not really slow, we did get our order fast, but when I asked for mayo she brought it but I had to use my fingers to spread it, and she never came back.
Cafe can't believe it's fantastic stress free environment...

I want to love this place because I believe that their hearts are really in it, but I continue to be under-impressed. Even the 4 star rating I'm giving them here is a stretch for me. I'm only giving it to them because I know they try. It's just that in my opinion, the people running this place can't seem to bring the package together. The pastries are wonderful. But I'd probably be less disappointed in the experience of getting them, if I could get them from a drivethru window. There's something about the ambience or atmosphere of this place that kills the pleasure of the pastry for me. But I keep going back. Hoping. And enjoying the taste of their wonderful creations.

I go for the salads and coffee/drinks. I am not a big fan of their dessert section, sadly. I've had several different ones, some are their brownies macaroons and cakes. They are all dry like they've been sitting out for a while or maybe overbaked. But this place is awesome to study. It is very cute and relaxing, plenty of seating but not many outlets so you wanna scope out a good place if you really wanna get some work done.
Food, and especially the desserts, was delicious! Had the chicken salad. Bravo! Could honestly use a good dusting/vacuuming of the lamps and other fixtures, however! Thanks!

I just love this place.  They offer a French coffee shop vibe.  Breakfast, lunch, salads and sweet treats.  They even have quite a few gluten free options.  The macaroons are the best, and the sandwiches can be made with gluten free bread.
This place is incredible, great people, great food and great coffee.
Get the salted caramel brownie. You're welcome in advance
Great food. Love the atmosphere.
Amazing food, pastry, and customer service
Great croissant and coffee. Great ambiance.
On the higher side. Their bakery is what you need to go for.
Great place for dessert after dinner.
Love the food!
Pastries!

Moving from Atlanta, it has been hard for me to find restaurants and bistro's that I like. I just had the most amazing chicken sun-dried tomato pesto sandwich with spinach and a salted caramel macaroon. The decor and atmosphere was so lovely. I will definitely be going back soon.

Very cool place for setting up to work for a few hours and right downtown for when you are looking to take a break.  Good service and fun decor.  I have only had the drinks here and not any food...  Either way it is good.  I wish there was more seating...
Best bakery in town
Absolutely delicious!
Such good food. A very popular date night local for me and my girlfriend. Can't go wrong with the fig, bacon,  and brie tartini!
Food was good the restaurant was very dusty where we sat upstairs
Pricy, but good.

The girl that took my order laid the french press parts on the counter where she took all the money she handled the cups with her fingers on the inside of the cup she took money in between never used gloves or washed her hands
Wonderful coffee and bakery. Pastries have never disappointed.

Great atmosphere for date, family, or working online. Friendly staff, but not the best communication between them about our order. Glad we stopped in on our vacation. If we lived here, we'd probably come regularly.
Best turkey and bri! Lovely pastries!

The macaroons  they make here are great they make them in quite a few flavors. We had cotton candy flavor.  I had a chicken salad sandwich on a croissant.  It was OK, the chicken was in big pieces, I like my chicken cut up more. Very busy place at lunch time every seat was taken and they have lots of seating.
Neat location in Rock Hill with an upstairs lounge spot. Outdoor seating available. Parking available on surrounding streets or in uptown public parking lot a couple streets down.
It's not a bad place, doesn't have many options and some of the pastries are a little plane but overall the place is nice.
Loved this place at first and I was a steady customer but very saddened by their downsizing of their pastries portions so  small now compared too how it was,,,I have stopped going because of this!!!

The pastries are so so good & reasonably priced for the quality. The atmosphere is pretty cool with the inside being pretty eclectic. Having the lock fence is definitely a cool touch. The service was okay, but did take a while, even though there was only 2 other people inside.
The food is fresh and full of flavor. Best baguette around.

The food was delicious, and reasonably priced, the service was quick and efficient. The atmosphere is so cool w/the mismatched tables/chairs, making for a great experience all the way around. And the coffee is the best in town. And the pastries are to many to choose, you'll want to taste them all. Wish they had a drive thru. But will definitely go.back again and again.
We stop here every time we are in Rock Hill. They have the best macarons!
Local and unique really nice way spend a Saturday morning. Awesome buttery croissants
Everything about this place is delicious
Really fun and cute place with great hot teas and bakery items. Cozy and inviting!
I love this quaint, lovely place.  The food is wonderful, especially the desserts.
I'm so happy we stopped here. The service was terrific. The coffee and food was so good! We had the fig, Brie, and bacon tartine and the prosciutto, Brie, and Blueberry vinegeratte  tartine.
Nice place to meet up with others. The soups are really good.

The food is absolutely amazing. The menu choices are so wonderful that it is hard to choose . The pastries are so delicious that the offerings of mini versions allows you to try more than one at a time. This place has gluten free options, which is a plus for me, a variety of drinks and pastries. This particular location is absolutely adorable inside with seating on multiple floors. Their food is delicious.
Hands down, best coffee in town.
Very tasty, had peru coffee and half fig, bacon, brie toast, yummy

Let's face it.  This company knows what they are doing!  This is an authentic place that has dominated the greater Charlotte area with the hip Cafe thing.  This place is expanding and really does have the potential to go global like Starbucks if they get lucky.  They are also priced very well.  If you do not specifically like French pastries you may not like this place.  They are not overly sweet like processed foods in other areas.  You may get something thinking it has light fluffy dough and find out that it is flaky in texture.  It will be a culinary adventure for you!  Finally, are you gluten free? Good!  They have stuff for you here.  You will see a hip person in the back assemble your sandwich with TLC.  They also have gluten free pastries including macaroons and their signature salted caramel brownie.  This is a MUST VISIT landmark in the area.  Definitely a destination restaurant.  Check them out or you will feel "le not good."
The pastries are amazing!
Great French bakery.
Good place for dessert
My son and I love it here. Sandwiches are great!
Awesome desert's......street side tables to enjoy the coffee and sweets....!!
Delicious pastry and coffee.
Amelie's got me through my first year at college in Rock Hill and introduced me to the best sandwich combo, turkey and brie. Their pastries are also on point and the coffee is solid.
I went here for a business meeting and it was quite delightful
I moved away 2 years ago & it was as good as I remember!
You can tell the owner loves their restaurant

Very cool atmosphere

I love Amelie's desserts. It has a great flavor and great texture. However, this time was different. The matcha was not well blended. It had gritty texture with a lot of sediment. The white dessert I ordered was stale and lacking of flavor. Also the customer service was a little bit unfriendly.
